description: ​The U.S. Justice Department charged five individuals today, a U.S. Citizen woman, a Ukrainian man, and three foreign nationals, for their involvement in cyber schemes that generated revenue for North Korea's nuclear weapons program. [...]
title: Five charged for cyber schemes to benefit North Korea's weapons program

description: The Norwegian National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) recommends replacing SSLVPN/WebVPN solutions with alternatives due to the repeated exploitation of related vulnerabilities in edge network devices to breach corporate networks. [...]
title: Norway recommends replacing SSL VPN to prevent breaches

description: ​Microsoft has shared a temporary fix for a known issue preventing Microsoft 365 customers from replying to encrypted emails using the Outlook Desktop client. [...]
title: Microsoft shares temp fix for Outlook encrypted email reply issues

description: Electronic prescription provider MediSecure in Australia has shut down its website and phone lines following a ransomware attack believed to originate from a third-party vendor. [...]
title: MediSecure e-script firm hit by ‘large-scale’ ransomware data breach

description: Security researchers discovered two previously unseen backdoors dubbed LunarWeb and LunarMail that were used to compromise a European government's diplomatic institutions abroad. [...]
title: Russian hackers use new Lunar malware to breach a European govt's agencies

description: ​Microsoft has acknowledged a new known issue causing this month's KB5037765 security update for Windows Server 2019 to fail to install with 0x800f0982 errors. [...]
title: Microsoft: Windows Server 2019 updates fail with 0x800f0982 errors

description: The North Korean hacker group Kimsuki has been using a new Linux malware called Gomir that is a version of the GoBear backdoor delivered via trojanized software installers. [...]
title: Kimsuky hackers deploy new Linux backdoor in attacks on South Korea

description: The North Korean hacker group Kimsuki has been using trojanized software packages to deliver a new Linux malware called Gomir in cyberespionage campaigns against targets in South Korea. [...]
title: Kimsuky hackers deploy new Linux backdoor via trojanized installers
